instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Multiple SMC IO failures
threads.message:
Board arrived untouched with no liquid damage. Typical GPU failure Replaced GPU and boots into OS now but fans spin fast from multiple SMC IO failures see picture.

Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR>

<CHIP>U5550</CHIP> pin 1 3.2V

<RESISTOR>R5550</RESISTOR> 1 and 2 are correct

Bad SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Multiple SMC IO failures
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Multiple SMC IO failures
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U5520</CHIP>/70, components and their traces.
Also test disconnecting webcam.
Post <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage, just in case.
